thread.title: Washington OC Sean McVay reportedly 'crushed' his interview with Rams
thread.title_full: Washington OC Sean McVay reportedly 'crushed' his interview with Rams

title: Washington OC Sean McVay reportedly 'crushed' his interview with Rams
text:
By: Tanya Ray Fox | 1 hour ago 
Sean McVay’s 31st birthday is coming up on January 24th, and if things are going as well as reported, he may have quite the promotion to celebrate. 
Multiple teams set their sights on the offensive coordinator for Washington as soon as the regular season was over, and both the Los Angeles Rams and the San Francisco 49ers have now completed their interviews. Related: Rams meet with head coach candidates Sean McVay and Harold Goodwin 
Per NFL.com’s Michael Silver, both teams were very impressed. Sean McVay has had two interviews (Rams, 49ers) and crushed them both. And my sources on this are not Sean McVay or his agent… 
— Michael Silver (@MikeSilver) January 9, 2017 
McVay has done a great job developing Kirk Cousins in Washington, which has undoubtedly played a major role in the Rams interest in him as a serious head coaching candidate. The Rams bet the house on Jared Goff when they traded up to draft him first overall in 2016, and so his success is paramount. Related: Washington offensive coordinator Sean McVay is a sleeper for Rams job 
If McVay is some kind of young quarterback whisperer, he could be a game-changer for Los Angeles. In fact, if a barely 31-year-old is going to head coach any team, the very young Rams are probably the best fit in the NFL. 
On the other hand, McVay would become the youngest head coach in the history of the league; and those who have previously earned that distinguished honor have not generally fared well. Related: Rams to interview Texans linebackers coach Mike Vrabel for head coach 
The current record holder for the youngest NFL head coach ever hired was Lane Kiffin, who signed on with the Oakland Raiders when he was 31 years, 8 months old in 2007. He made it to 5-15 with the team before being fired after Week 4 of the 2008 season. More Latest Rams news!
